analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba des nga 'jig rten shes pa 'gog pa shes pa brnyes so //

analyzed: moonggal gyi bu /
translated: “Maudgalyāyana,

analyzed: par brtson par bya'o //

original: moonggal gyi bu /
analyzed: moonggal gyi bu /
translated: Maudgalyāyana,

analyzed: 'jig rten shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes par bya ba'i don du bdag 'jig rten shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa mngon par rdzogs par shes nas sems can rnams la ji ltar yang dag par rab tu bstan par bya snyam nas dge ba'i

analyzed: rtsa ba rnam pa sna tshogs du ma dag mngon par 'dus byas so /
translated: I have accumulated various kinds of roots of virtue.

analyzed: moonggal gyi bu /

original: sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus 'khor ba dpag tu med pa nas de'i pha rol gyi'ang chos pha rol na rgyal po 'od ces bya ba chos kyi rgyal po chos dang ldan pa zhig byung ngo //

translated: In the past, countless eons ago, there was a king named Prabhāvat, a righteous Dharma king.

original: rin po ce sna bdun dang ldan te /🔽de'i rin po ce sna bdun ni /
analyzed: rin po ce sna bdun dang ldan te / de'i rin po ce sna bdun ni /
translated: He possessed the seven precious substances.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: His seven precious substances were:🔽the precious wheel,🔽the precious elephant, the precious horse,🔽the precious jewel, the precious woman,

original: 'khor lo rin po ce dang / glang po rin po ce dang /rta rin po ce dang / nor bu rin po ce dang /bud med rin po ce dang / khyim bdag rin po ce dang / blon po rin po ce ste /
analyzed: 'khor lo rin po ce dang / glang po rin po ce dang /rta rin po ce dang / nor bu rin po ce dang /bud med rin po ce dang / khyim bdag rin po ce dang / blon po rin po ce ste /

original: rin po ce 'de bdun no //
analyzed: rin po ce 'de bdun no //
translated: These were his seven precious substances.

analyzed: bu'ang stong tham pa byung ste dpa' zhing rtul phod la yan lag mchog gi gzugs dang ldan pa pha rol gyi sde rab tu 'joms pa'o //
translated: He had a thousand sons, who were brave, heroic, and had the bodies of supreme beings, able to conquer the armies of others.

original: des dkyil 'khor chen po 'di nyid cad pa med cing tshon gyis bda' ba med la /
analyzed: des dkyil 'khor chen po 'di nyid cad pa med cing tshon gyis bda' ba med la /
translated: He turned this very great maṇḍala without omission or addition,

original: rang gi chos kyis shin tu gnas so //
analyzed: rang gi chos kyis shin tu gnas so //
translated: and he remained in his own Dharma.

analyzed: de'i tshe de bzhin gshegs pa spyod pa zhi ba zhes bya ba rab tu byung ba'i tshogs dge 'dun dpag tu med pa'i 'khor dang / @306b dge bsnyen khri phrag dpag tu med pa'i 'khor dang / lha bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag dpag tu med pa'i 'khor dang /
translated: At that time, the thus-gone one Peaceful Conduct had an assembly of monks and an entourage of countless saṅgha members, an entourage of countless tens of thousands of male and female lay practitioners, and an entourage of countless trillions of gods.

original: klu bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag dpag tu med pa'i 'khor byung ngo //
analyzed: klu bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag dpag tu med pa'i 'khor byung ngo //
translated: He also had an entourage of countless trillions of nāgas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa spyod pa zhi ba de'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing der sems can rnams kyi yongs su spyod pa 'di lta bu byung ste /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa spyod pa zhi ba de'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing der sems can rnams kyi yongs su spyod pa 'di lta bu byung ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: In the buddha realm of the thus-gone Peaceful Conduct, the following things were available to the beings there:

original: dper na / byang gi sgra mi snyan gyi mi rnams kyi tshe'i tshad du sems can de dag gi tshe'i tshad de bzhin zhes te /🔽lo stong du tshe'i tshad nges pa ni /
analyzed: dper na / byang gi sgra mi snyan gyi mi rnams kyi tshe'i tshad du sems can de dag gi tshe'i tshad de bzhin zhes te / lo stong du tshe'i tshad nges pa ni /
translated: For example, the lifespan of the beings there was like that of the humans of Kuru in the north.

original: ma yin la /
analyzed: ma yin la /
translated: Their lifespan was not fixed at one thousand years,

original: tshe dpag tu med par gyur te /
analyzed: tshe dpag tu med par gyur te /
translated: but was immeasurable.

original: tshe'i tshad du ma phyin par bar du 'chi ba'i dus mi byed do //
analyzed: tshe'i tshad du ma phyin par bar du 'chi ba'i dus mi byed do //
translated: He did not die before his lifespan was exhausted.

original: de rgyal po 'od byed blon po bdun stong tsam dang lhan cig rgyal phran lnga stong tsam dang lhan cig tu bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa spyod pa zhi ba ga la ba der song ste phyin nas bcom ldan 'das de'i zhabs la mgo bos phyag 'tshal
analyzed: de rgyal po 'od byed blon po bdun stong tsam dang lhan cig rgyal phran lnga stong tsam dang lhan cig tu bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa spyod pa zhi ba ga la ba der song ste phyin nas bcom ldan 'das de'i zhabs la mgo bos phyag 'tshal
translated: “The king, together with his seven thousand ministers and his five thousand vassal kings, went to the place where the Bhagavān, the Tathāgata Śāntamati, was residing. When they arrived, they bowed their heads to the Bhagavān’s feet

original: te phyogs gcig tu 'dug go /
analyzed: te phyogs gcig tu 'dug go /
translated: and sat to one side.

original: blon po bdun stong po de dag gis kyang bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa spyod pa zhi ba'i zhabs la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te /
analyzed: blon po bdun stong po de dag gis kyang bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa spyod pa zhi ba'i zhabs la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te /
translated: Those seven thousand ministers also bowed their heads to the Bhagavān, the Tathāgata Śāntamati’s feet

original: phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa spyod pa zhi ba la tshigs su bcad pas zhu ba zhus pa /🔽gzugs la ji ltar brtags na 'dun pa 'dod chags med //
analyzed: phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa spyod pa zhi ba la tshigs su bcad pas zhu ba zhus pa / gzugs la ji ltar brtags na 'dun pa 'dod chags med //
translated: and sat to one side. Then they asked the Bhagavān, the Tathāgata Śāntamati, in verse:🔽“How should one regard form so that there is no desire or passion?

original: ji ltar gzugs las byung na phung krol mya nyan med //
analyzed: ji ltar gzugs las byung na phung krol mya nyan med //
translated: How should one emerge from form so that there is no danger or distress?

original: gzugs las byung na ji @307a *//
analyzed: gzugs las byung na ji @307a *//
translated: If it arises from form,

original: ltar phung po so sor rtog /
analyzed: ltar phung po so sor rtog /
translated: How does one investigate the aggregates individually?

original: ji ltar gzugs dang bral zhing zhi ba ji ltar tshol //
analyzed: ji ltar gzugs dang bral zhing zhi ba ji ltar tshol //
translated: How is it free from form and peaceful? How is it sought?

original: ji ltar bya rgyal ji ltar sgo nga sbubs bya bzhin du //
analyzed: ji ltar bya rgyal ji ltar sgo nga sbubs bya bzhin du //
translated: Like a bird king breaking out of its eggshell,

original: yul la mthong ba bcom nas dpa' bo ji ltar mchi //
analyzed: yul la mthong ba bcom nas dpa' bo ji ltar mchi //
translated: How does the hero go, having destroyed the view of objects?

original: 'jig rten mi dag mi gsum gyis ni gdungs pa na //
analyzed: 'jig rten mi dag mi gsum gyis ni gdungs pa na //
translated: When the three kinds of people in the world are tormented,

original: mun kun bcom nas ji ltar mya ngan 'das par mchi //
analyzed: mun kun bcom nas ji ltar mya ngan 'das par mchi //
translated: How does one attain nirvana, having destroyed all darkness?

original: phung po khams dang skye mched ji ltar yongs su gtong //
analyzed: phung po khams dang skye mched ji ltar yongs su gtong //
translated: How does one abandon the aggregates, elements, and sense bases?

original: me 'bar zhi ba lta bu dbang po ji ltar dor //
analyzed: me 'bar zhi ba lta bu dbang po ji ltar dor //
translated: How does one discard the faculties, like extinguishing a blazing fire?🔽How does one become the unsurpassed object of offerings in the world with its gods,

original: lhar bcas 'jig rten ji ltar bla med yon gnas dang // dpa' bo yon sbyong ji ltar sems can rab tu 'grel //
analyzed: lhar bcas 'jig rten ji ltar bla med yon gnas dang // dpa' bo yon sbyong ji ltar sems can rab tu 'grel //
translated: And how does the hero purify beings?

original: me zhig lta bu ji ltar 'gro bar 'jigs ma mchis //
analyzed: me zhig lta bu ji ltar 'gro bar 'jigs ma mchis //
translated: How does one go without fear, like a fire that is extinguished?

original: las dang nyon mongs thams cad kun tu ji ltar zhi //
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs thams cad kun tu ji ltar zhi //
translated: How are all karma and afflictions completely pacified?

original: mya ngan 'das par 'gro ba'i skye ba ji ltar 'thob; ;gdugs dang rgyal mtshan ba dan mchog gis mchod par 'gyur //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das par 'gro ba'i skye ba ji ltar 'thob; ;gdugs dang rgyal mtshan ba dan mchog gis mchod par 'gyur //
translated: They will be worshipped with the best of parasols, victory banners, and flags.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa spyod zhi bstan pa bde bar gshegs //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa spyod zhi bstan pa bde bar gshegs //
translated: The Tathāgata, who has the peaceful conduct of the Sugata,

original: rkang gnyis mchog gis chos kun gzigs pas de lung bstan //
analyzed: rkang gnyis mchog gis chos kun gzigs pas de lung bstan //
translated: The one with the highest two feet, who sees all phenomena, has prophesied this.

original: shes rab kyis bsal 'dod chags zhe sdang gti mug spang //
analyzed: shes rab kyis bsal 'dod chags zhe sdang gti mug spang //
translated: Through wisdom, attachment, anger, and ignorance are eliminated.

original: shes pas phung po shes bya sems can med shes kyis //
analyzed: shes pas phung po shes bya sems can med shes kyis //
translated: Through knowledge, the aggregates are known, and through the knowledge of the absence of sentient beings

original: chags pa mar me zad 'dra chags med nye bar zhi //
analyzed: chags pa mar me zad 'dra chags med nye bar zhi //
translated: Attachment is like a lamp that is extinguished, and non-attachment is peace.

original: lha mi dri za de dag 'gro ba mi shes te //
analyzed: lha mi dri za de dag 'gro ba mi shes te //
translated: The gods, humans, and gandharvas do not know that destination.

original: las dang nyon mongs shes shing srid shes mya ngan med //
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs shes shing srid shes mya ngan med //
translated: Knowing karma and afflictions, knowing existence, there is no sorrow.

original: me shing zad pa lta bur chags med mya @307b ngan 'da'//
analyzed: me shing zad pa lta bur chags med mya @307b ngan 'da'//
translated: Like a fire that has consumed its firewood, there is nirvāṇa without attachment.

original: gang tshe sred dang bral gyur rnams shes rgyud bsregs shing //
analyzed: gang tshe sred dang bral gyur rnams shes rgyud bsregs shing //
translated: When those who are free from craving burn the continuum of consciousness

original: sdug bsngal myu gu mi sgrub ye shes me yis bsros //
analyzed: sdug bsngal myu gu mi sgrub ye shes me yis bsros //
translated: And warm themselves with the fire of wisdom that does not produce the sprouts of suffering,

original: de yi 'gro ba med de me lce 'bar ba bzhin //
analyzed: de yi 'gro ba med de me lce 'bar ba bzhin //
translated: Their destination is non-existent, like a blazing flame.

original: sangs rgyas kun gyis 'du byed 'gro ba med par bstan //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyis 'du byed 'gro ba med par bstan //
translated: The buddhas have taught that conditioned things do not go anywhere.

original: de nas rgyal po 'od byed des de bzhin gshegs pa spyod pa zhi ba la rin po che'i me tog thams cad kyis mngon par gtor /
analyzed: de nas rgyal po 'od byed des de bzhin gshegs pa spyod pa zhi ba la rin po che'i me tog thams cad kyis mngon par gtor /
translated: “Then King Prabhāsa scattered all the precious flowers over the thus-gone Śāntacārin,

original: mngon par rab tu gtor cing /
analyzed: mngon par rab tu gtor cing /
translated: and he scattered them again and again.

original: de'i 'og tu spos dang me tog dag gis kyang gtor to //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu spos dang me tog dag gis kyang gtor to //
translated: After that, he also scattered incense and flowers.

original: de dge ba'i rtsa ba des bskal pa grangs med pa bdun cu rtsa drug tu ngan 'gro dang nam yang dbul ba'i rigs dang / nam yang rigs dma' bar ma skyes so //
analyzed: de dge ba'i rtsa ba des bskal pa grangs med pa bdun cu rtsa drug tu ngan 'gro dang nam yang dbul ba'i rigs dang / nam yang rigs dma' bar ma skyes so //
translated: By that root of virtue, for seventy-six countless eons he never took birth in the lower realms, never in a poor family, and never in a family of low caste.

original: moonggal gyi bu /
analyzed: moonggal gyi bu /
translated: “Maudgalyāyana,

original: de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: de ji snyam du sems /
translated: what do you think?

original: de'i tshe de'i dus na rgyal po 'od byed ces bya bar gyur pa de gzhan yin par sems na /
analyzed: de'i tshe de'i dus na rgyal po 'od byed ces bya bar gyur pa de gzhan yin par sems na /
translated: If you think that the one who was King Prabhāsa at that time, on that occasion, was someone else,

original: de ltar mi blta ste /
analyzed: de ltar mi blta ste /
translated: you should reconsider that.

original: nga de'i tshe de'i dus na rgyal po 'od byed ces bya bar gyur te /
analyzed: nga de'i tshe de'i dus na rgyal po 'od byed ces bya bar gyur te /
translated: It was I who was King Prabhāsa at that time, on that occasion.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa spyod pa zhi ba de dag la bar rin po che sna bdun gyi me tog dang / spos dang me tog dag gis mngon par gtor nas ngas gzhal du med pa'i gus pa byas so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa spyod pa zhi ba de dag la bar rin po che sna bdun gyi me tog dang / spos dang me tog dag gis mngon par gtor nas ngas gzhal du med pa'i gus pa byas so //
translated: I scattered flowers of the seven precious substances and incense and flowers over those thus-gone ones who were practicing peace, and I paid them immeasurable respect.

original: moonggal gyi bu /
analyzed: moonggal gyi bu /
translated: “Maudgalyāyana,

original: de lta bas na /
analyzed: de lta bas na /
translated: therefore,

original: byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la gus pa gzhal du med pa bskyed par bya /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la gus pa gzhal du med pa bskyed par bya /
translated: when bodhisattvas practice bodhisattva conduct, they should generate immeasurable respect for the blessed buddhas.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems kyang yongs su mi gtang bar bya /🔽thams cad mkhyen pa @308a *//
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems kyang yongs su mi gtang bar bya / thams cad mkhyen pa @308a *//
translated: They should not give up the mind of omniscience.

original: nyid kyi sems yongs su ma btang ba'i byang chub sems dpa' ni /
analyzed: nyid kyi sems yongs su ma btang ba'i byang chub sems dpa' ni /
translated: Bodhisattvas who do not give up the mind of omniscience

original: myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: will quickly become irreversible from unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.”

original: moonggal gyi bu /
analyzed: moonggal gyi bu /
translated: “Maudgalyāyana,

original: ngas bsam gtan shes par bya ba'i don du byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa na bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas ji ltar zhi gnas kyi dbang pos nges par 'byung bar bya snyam nas
analyzed: ngas bsam gtan shes par bya ba'i don du byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa na bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas ji ltar zhi gnas kyi dbang pos nges par 'byung bar bya snyam nas
translated: I practiced bodhisattva conduct for the sake of understanding meditative concentration, thinking, ‘When I have attained manifestly perfect buddhahood in unsurpassed, genuinely perfect enlightenment, I will ensure that sentient beings are liberated by means of the faculty of meditative concentration.’

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam pa sna tshogs rgya che ba du ma dag mngon par 'dus byas te /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam pa sna tshogs rgya che ba du ma dag mngon par 'dus byas te /
translated: I accumulated roots of virtue of many different kinds, and on a vast scale.

original: moonggal gyi bu /
analyzed: moonggal gyi bu /
translated: “Maudgalyāyana,🔽in the past, infinite, innumerable, inconceivable, incomparable, immeasurable, and inexpressible numbers of eons ago, there appeared a king named Sarvarakṣa.

original: sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus 'khor ba dpag tu med pa de'i pha rol gyi'ang ches pha rol na rgyal po thams cad skyob ces bya ba zhig byung ste; rgyal po thams cad skyo ba de'i btsun mo bud med drug khri brgyad stong byung ste lha'i bu mo'i🔽gzugs dang 'dra zhing /🔽ma ltar byams pa /🔽sru mo ltar yid gcugs pa /
analyzed: sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus 'khor ba dpag tu med pa de'i pha rol gyi'ang ches pha rol na rgyal po thams cad skyob ces bya ba zhig byung ste; rgyal po thams cad skyo ba de'i btsun mo bud med drug khri brgyad stong byung ste lha'i bu mo'i gzugs dang 'dra zhing / ma ltar byams pa / sru mo ltar yid gcugs pa /
translated: King Sarvarakṣa had sixty-eight thousand queens who were like celestial maidens in appearance,🔽loving like mothers,🔽trusting like sisters,

original: bran mo ltar gus pa /
analyzed: bran mo ltar gus pa /
translated: respectful like servants,🔽and

original: lha mo ltar yon tan can de dag gi nang na rgyal po thams cad skyo ba 'dug ste /
analyzed: lha mo ltar yon tan can de dag gi nang na rgyal po thams cad skyo ba 'dug ste /
translated: “Among those who are endowed with qualities like goddesses, the king is the most weary.

original: 'dod pa las dben pa /
analyzed: 'dod pa las dben pa /
translated: He is secluded from desire,

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos las dben pa /
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos las dben pa /
translated: secluded from evil, unwholesome dharmas,

original: rtogs pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa /
analyzed: rtogs pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa /
translated: with applied thought and with sustained thought,

original: dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba'i bsam gtan dang po rdzogs par byas te gnas so //
analyzed: dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba'i bsam gtan dang po rdzogs par byas te gnas so //
translated: he dwells having attained the first meditative concentration that possesses applied and sustained thought and joy and happiness born of seclusion.

original: de bzhin du @308b bsam gtan bzhi pa'i bar rdzogs par byas te gnas so //
analyzed: de bzhin du @308b bsam gtan bzhi pa'i bar rdzogs par byas te gnas so //
translated: In the same way, he dwells having attained the second meditative concentration, the third meditative concentration, and the fourth meditative concentration.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa las snyoms par zhugs nas bsam gtan bzhi pa las langs te /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa las snyoms par zhugs nas bsam gtan bzhi pa las langs te /
translated: Having entered into the fourth meditative concentration, he rises from the fourth meditative concentration,

original: sems can dag 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la mos shing 'dod pa la lhag par chags /
analyzed: sems can dag 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la mos shing 'dod pa la lhag par chags /
translated: and he sees sentient beings who are devoted to the five sensory pleasures, who are attached to the pleasures of the sensory aggre-gates,

original: sdig pa'i las dag kun tu spyod cing /
analyzed: sdig pa'i las dag kun tu spyod cing /
translated: who are engaged in evil deeds,

original: sdig pa'i las dag byas pas ngan 'gror rab tu ltung ste /🔽kha cig ni /
analyzed: sdig pa'i las dag byas pas ngan 'gror rab tu ltung ste / kha cig ni /
translated: and who, because of the evil deeds they have done, will fall into the lower realms.

original: sems can dmyal bar /🔽kha cig ni /
analyzed: sems can dmyal bar / kha cig ni /
translated: Some will fall into the hells.

original: dud 'gro'i skye gnas su /🔽kha cig ni /

When their bodies break up, they will become Brahmās in the Brahmā world, and having been born as Great Brahmās, they will be overwhelming and unoverwhelmed.🔽And after they die, at the time of the destruction of the eon, they will be born in the Heaven of the Clear Light.

analyzed: 'od gsal gyi lha rnams kyi nang du skyes nas bskal pa 'jig pa'i tshe 'ang tshangs pa'i 'jig rten du skyes so //

analyzed: des tshangs pa'i 'jig rten der 'dug pa na sems can bye ba khrag khrig dpag tu med pa dag phyir mi ldog pa nyid la btsud do //

analyzed: yang 'jig rten 'jig pa na 'od gsal gyi lha rnams kyi nang du skyes te /

analyzed: des gnas pa der sems can khrag khrig dpag tu med pa dag phyir mi ldog pa nyid la rab tu btsud do //

analyzed: thabs brgya stong 'di byas pas tshangs pa'i 'jig rten nas shi nas 'od gsal gyi lha'i nang du /

analyzed: 'od gsal nas tshangs pa'i 'jig rten du /

translated: If a buddha has appeared, they become the attendant of that buddha bhagavān.🔽They know that the tathāgata is dwelling in bliss

analyzed: gal te dben pas de bzhin gshegs pa bzhugs so zhes shes so //

analyzed: de ji snyam du sems / de'i tshe de'i dus na rgyal po thams cad skyob ces bya bar gyur pa de gzhan @310a *//
translated: what do you think?

original: yin par sems na /
analyzed: yin par sems na /
translated: If you think that the one who was King Sarvatāyin at that time, on that occasion, was someone else,

original: de ltar mi blta ste /
analyzed: de ltar mi blta ste /
translated: you should not see it in that way.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: nga de'i tshe de'i dus na rgyal po thams cad skyob ces bya bar gyur to //

analyzed: ngas de'i tshe'ang skye bo yul la chags pa dag bsam gtan la bkod cing /

analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam la dgod par bya'o //
translated: and establish them on the path to nirvāṇa.”

original: moonggal gyi bu /
analyzed: moonggal gyi bu /

analyzed: de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'jig rten gyi don byed par 'dod pas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam la bslab par bya'o //
translated: bodhisattva mahāsattvas who wish to benefit the world should train in the path to omniscience.

original: moonggal gyi bu /
analyzed: moonggal gyi bu /
translated: “Maudgalyāyana,

analyzed: ngas bsam gtan shes pa kun 'byung ba shes par bya ba'i don du sngon byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa na yul la sdud par gzhol ba'i sems can rnams bdag slob par rjes su bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi lam
translated: in the past, when I was practicing bodhisattva conduct in order to understand the knowledge of the arising of the knowledge of dhyāna, I taught the path to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening to those beings who were focused on the objects of the senses and were my students.

original: ji ltar bstan par bya snyam nas dge ba'i rtsa ba sna tshogs du ma dag mngon par 'dus byas so //
analyzed: ji ltar bstan par bya snyam nas dge ba'i rtsa ba sna tshogs du ma dag mngon par 'dus byas so //
translated: I thought, ‘How should I teach?’ and I accumulated various roots of virtue.

original: moonggal gyi bu /
analyzed: moonggal gyi bu /
translated: “Maudgalyāyana,

translated: In the past, infinite aeons ago, beyond aeons that are incalculable and beyond even further incalculable aeons, a thus-gone one called Abiding Peace appeared in the world, and so on up to: a buddha, a blessed one.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa @310b zhi ba'i gnas de'i sku tshe'i tshad ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa @310b zhi ba'i gnas de'i sku tshe'i tshad ni /

analyzed: lo bye ba khrag khrig phrag bdun cur gyur to //

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa zhi ba'i gnas de'i nyan thos 'dus pa dang bo ni /
translated: The first assembly of hearers of the thus-gone Abiding Peace

analyzed: dgra bcom pa nas sems kyi dbang thams cad kyi dam pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar nyan thos khri byung ngo //

analyzed: de'i byang chub sems dpa' 'dus pa dang po brgyad cu byung ngo //

original: nyan thos 'dus pa gnyis pa ni /
analyzed: nyan thos 'dus pa gnyis pa ni /

translated: There were also nine hundred and ninety trillion śrāvakas, from the arhats whose defilements were exhausted to those who had attained mastery over their minds and had reached the highest perfection.

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'dus pa ni; de'i nyis 'gyur byung ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'dus pa ni; de'i nyis 'gyur byung ste /
translated: The assembly of bodhisattvas was twice that number.

analyzed: de dag thams cad theg pa chen po la yang dag par rab tu gnas pa nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa dpag tu med cing tshad med pa dang ldan pa'i bar du'o //
translated: All of them were established in the Great Vehicle, and they possessed immeasurable and limitless pure buddha realms.

original: thabs 'dis de bzhin gshegs pa de'i nyan thos 'dus pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' 'dus pa dpag tu med pa byung ngo //
analyzed: thabs 'dis de bzhin gshegs pa de'i nyan thos 'dus pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' 'dus pa dpag tu med pa byung ngo //
translated: Through this method, the assembly of śrāvakas of that tathāgata and the assembly of bodhisattvas became immeasurable.

original: de'i tshe de bzhin gshegs pa de'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing der byang chub sems dpa' zhi gnas gus pa zhes bya ba zhig byung ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe de bzhin gshegs pa de'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing der byang chub sems dpa' zhi gnas gus pa zhes bya ba zhig byung ste /
translated: At that time, in the buddha realm of that tathāgata, there was a bodhisattva named Śamatha-gaurava.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa de'i de bzhin gshegs pa bzhugs pa'i rjes su 'brang bas zhi gnas la gus par gyur to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa de'i de bzhin gshegs pa bzhugs pa'i rjes su 'brang bas zhi gnas la gus par gyur to //
translated: He was devoted to śamatha because he followed the Tathāgata who was the Tathāgata of that time.

original: gzhan yang sngon gyi rgyal ba la bsnyen bkur byas pas 'dra bar rnam par mthong ba dang ldan par gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang sngon gyi rgyal ba la bsnyen bkur byas pas 'dra bar rnam par mthong ba dang ldan par gyur te /
translated: Moreover, he was endowed with insight because he had served the Victorious Ones of the past.

original: de'i zhi @311a *//
analyzed: de'i zhi @311a *//
translated: His śamatha

original: gnas gang rnam par mthong ba thob nas snying rje chen pos non pa'i sems kyis bsam gtan shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa thob nas thabs mkhas pas zhi gnas kyang mi mthong la rnam par mthong ba la'ang bsten to //
analyzed: gnas gang rnam par mthong ba thob nas snying rje chen pos non pa'i sems kyis bsam gtan shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa thob nas thabs mkhas pas zhi gnas kyang mi mthong la rnam par mthong ba la'ang bsten to //
translated: was such that, having attained insight, he did not see śamatha with a mind overwhelmed by great compassion, but he also did not abandon insight.

original: des rdzu 'phrul mngon du byas nas sprul pa stong mngon par sprul te skye bo yul gang la rnam par g-yengs pa dag sbyin pas bsdus so //
analyzed: des rdzu 'phrul mngon du byas nas sprul pa stong mngon par sprul te skye bo yul gang la rnam par g-yengs pa dag sbyin pas bsdus so //
translated: Having manifested his magical power, he manifested a thousand emanations and attracted the people who were distracted by objects with generosity.

original: sbyin pas bsdus nas tshul khrims la rab tu bkod do //
analyzed: sbyin pas bsdus nas tshul khrims la rab tu bkod do //
translated: Having attracted them with generosity, he established them in morality.

original: tshul khrims la bkod nas sangs rgyas kyi chos dag rab tu bstan to //
analyzed: tshul khrims la bkod nas sangs rgyas kyi chos dag rab tu bstan to //
translated: Having established them in morality, he taught them the Buddha’s teachings.

original: der sems can khrag khrig dpag tu med pa chos zab mo 'di'i bzod pa la rab tu btsud do //
analyzed: der sems can khrag khrig dpag tu med pa chos zab mo 'di'i bzod pa la rab tu btsud do //
translated: He introduced countless millions of sentient beings to the acceptance of the profound Dharma.

original: dam pa'i chos rnam par shes pa'i lus dang sems rgyas par yang dag par rab tu 'dzin par 'gyur /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos rnam par shes pa'i lus dang sems rgyas par yang dag par rab tu 'dzin par 'gyur /
translated: They came to possess the body and mind that are the result of the knowledge of the sacred Dharma.

original: snying rje chen po la'ang rab tu btsud /
analyzed: snying rje chen po la'ang rab tu btsud /
translated: He introduced them to great compassion.

original: sngon bsam gtan de dag la'ang rab tu btsud //
analyzed: sngon bsam gtan de dag la'ang rab tu btsud //
translated: He introduced them to the previous concentrations.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la'ang yun ring du goms pas de dag pha rol tu phyin pa drug la rab tu btsud de /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la'ang yun ring du goms pas de dag pha rol tu phyin pa drug la rab tu btsud de /
translated: They became familiar with the wisdom of omniscience for a long time and he introduced them to the six perfections.

original: yun mi ring bar yongs su dag pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas sems can khrag khrig dpag tu med pa yongs su mya ngan las zlo @311b zhing /🔽yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar byed do //🔽moonggal gyi bu /

translated: Before long they attained unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening in a completely pure buddha realm and liberated and brought to nirvana countless millions of sentient beings.

original: de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: de ji snyam du sems /
translated: “Maudgalyāyana, what do you think?

original: de'i tshe de'i dus na byang chub sems dpa' zhi gnas gus ba zhes bya ba de gzhan yin par sems na /

analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba dpag tu med pa dang ldan pa /

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dpag tu med pa rnams kyi tshangs par spyod pa shin tu spyad pa /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa de dag gi rim gro pa la na mang du byas par @326a *//
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dpag tu med pa rnams kyi tshangs par spyod pa shin tu spyad pa / de bzhin gshegs pa de dag gi rim gro pa la na mang du byas par @326a *//
translated: He had practiced pure conduct under immeasurable thus-gone ones.🔽He had served those thus-gone ones.

original: gyur to; ;de de bzhin gshegs pa de dag thams cad kyi byang chub kyi sems kyis de bzhin gshegs pa de dag gi rim gro ba byas nas 'di ltar sems bskyed de /
analyzed: gyur to; ;de de bzhin gshegs pa de dag thams cad kyi byang chub kyi sems kyis de bzhin gshegs pa de dag gi rim gro ba byas nas 'di ltar sems bskyed de /
translated: He had served those thus-gone ones with the mind set on awakening. He had the following thought:

original: bdag mtshan ma'i rim gros de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs mnyes par mi bya /
analyzed: bdag mtshan ma'i rim gros de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs mnyes par mi bya /
translated: I will not serve the Thus-Gone Ones with the performance of rites that involve characteristics.

original: bdag nam yang 'jig rten pa'i zang zing gi sems kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i rim gro mi bya /🔽gzhan du na bdag thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'dod pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa de dag la yid du 'thad /
analyzed: bdag nam yang 'jig rten pa'i zang zing gi sems kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i rim gro mi bya / gzhan du na bdag thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'dod pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa de dag la yid du 'thad /
translated: I will never serve the Thus-Gone Ones with a mind that is worldly and concerned with material things.

original: yid du mi 'thad pa mi yin pas rim 'gro bya'o //
analyzed: yid du mi 'thad pa mi yin pas rim 'gro bya'o //
translated: Rather, I will serve those thus-gone ones in a way that is agreeable to them, not disagreeable, because I desire omniscience.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la rim gro byas pa 'dis bdag thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob par gyur cig /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la rim gro byas pa 'dis bdag thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob par gyur cig /
translated: By serving the Thus-Gone Ones in this way, may I attain the wisdom of omniscience.

original: de ltar ngas sems bskyed nas ji ltar bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i sems can thams cad mngon par shes pa myur ba sla ba'i lam gyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang
analyzed: de ltar ngas sems bskyed nas ji ltar bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i sems can thams cad mngon par shes pa myur ba sla ba'i lam gyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang
translated: Having given rise to such an attitude, I will then, in accordance with the swift and easy path, attain unsurpassed and perfect awakening and become a perfect buddha. May all beings attain the swift and easy path to unsurpassed and perfect awakening.

original: chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya snyam nas des bdag byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa na sems can de dag thams cad mngon par shes pa myur ba sla ba'i lam gyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub rjes su thob par
analyzed: chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya snyam nas des bdag byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa na sems can de dag thams cad mngon par shes pa myur ba sla ba'i lam gyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub rjes su thob par
translated: “I will fully awaken to unsurpassed and perfect buddhahood.” With that thought, he made all those beings attain unsurpassed and perfect awakening through the easy path of swift superknowledge.

original: byas so // ji ltar bdag bla na @326b med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i zhing der sangs rgyas shin tu mang zhing sangs rgyas kyi dkon par ma gyur cig ces de lta bu'i sems kyis de bzhin gshegs pa de dag thams🔽cad kyi rim gro byas so //
analyzed: byas so // ji ltar bdag bla na @326b med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i zhing der sangs rgyas shin tu mang zhing sangs rgyas kyi dkon par ma gyur cig ces de lta bu'i sems kyis de bzhin gshegs pa de dag thams cad kyi rim gro byas so //
translated: “Just as I will fully awaken to unsurpassed and perfect buddhahood, may there be many buddhas in my buddhafield and may the buddhas not be rare.” With that thought, he served all those thus-gone ones.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba des nga'i bskal pa bzang po 'di la de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dgu brgya dgu bcu rtsa drug byung ngo //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba des nga'i bskal pa bzang po 'di la de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dgu brgya dgu bcu rtsa drug byung ngo //
translated: Through that root of virtue, during this Fortunate Eon, nine hundred and ninety-six thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddhas have appeared.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa gang dag la bdag gis byang chub sems dpa' de dag dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed du btsud pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa de dag thams cad la bdag gis mchod do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa gang dag la bdag gis byang chub sems dpa' de dag dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed du btsud pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa de dag thams cad la bdag gis mchod do //
translated: I have made offerings to all those Tathāgatas from whom I have received the roots of goodness that I have planted.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa de dag thams cad la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa de dag thams cad la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa ni /
translated: I have planted roots of goodness with all those Tathāgatas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa de dag thams cad la bdag gi lus kyi las yongs su dag pas rim gro byas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa de dag thams cad la bdag gi lus kyi las yongs su dag pas rim gro byas /
translated: I have served all those Tathāgatas with pure physical actions.

original: ngag gi las yongs su dag pas bstod /
analyzed: ngag gi las yongs su dag pas bstod /
translated: I have praised all those Tathāgatas with pure verbal actions.

original: yid kyi las yongs su dag pas nges par bsam mo //
analyzed: yid kyi las yongs su dag pas nges par bsam mo //
translated: I have contemplated all those Tathāgatas with pure mental actions.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba des nga'i sku rgya chen por gyur to //🔽ngas de bzhin gshegs pa de dag thams cad kyi rim gro yongs su spyad pas rnyed pa mchog dang / grags pa mchog thob bo //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba des nga'i sku rgya chen por gyur to // ngas de bzhin gshegs pa de dag thams cad kyi rim gro yongs su spyad pas rnyed pa mchog dang / grags pa mchog thob bo //
translated: By those roots of goodness, my body has become vast.🔽I have attained the highest gain and the highest fame by serving all those Tathāgatas.

original: ngas de bzhin gshegs pa de dag thams cad kyi gsung rab la brtson pa drag pos rab tu gnas so //
analyzed: ngas de bzhin gshegs pa de dag thams cad kyi gsung rab la brtson pa drag pos rab tu gnas so //
translated: I have lived in the teachings of all those Tathāgatas with intense effort.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba des nga'i sangs rgyas kyi @327a *//
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba des nga'i sangs rgyas kyi @327a *//
translated: By that root of virtue, may I become a buddha🔽

original: zhing rgya che ste /
analyzed: zhing rgya che ste /
translated: Through that root of merit, my buddha realm is vast

original: mtha' gzhal bar mi nus so //🔽moonggal gyi bu /
analyzed: mtha' gzhal bar mi nus so // moonggal gyi bu /
translated: and cannot be measured.

original: de lta bas na /
analyzed: de lta bas na /
translated: “Therefore, Maudgalyāyana,🔽bodhisattvas who wish for the highest gain and the highest fame,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnyed pa mchog dang grags pa mchog thob pa dang / gsung rab 'dod pas de bzhin gshegs pa la rim gro yongs su spyad cing sems yongs su dul bar bya /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnyed pa mchog dang grags pa mchog thob pa dang / gsung rab 'dod pas de bzhin gshegs pa la rim gro yongs su spyad cing sems yongs su dul bar bya /
translated: and who wish for the teachings, should serve the Tathāgata and tame their minds.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing rgya che bar 'dod pas sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes mthong ba sngon du byas te spyod pa spyad par bya /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing rgya che bar 'dod pas sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes mthong ba sngon du byas te spyod pa spyad par bya /
translated: Bodhisattvas who wish for a vast buddha realm should first attain unobstructed wisdom and then practice.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rtogs par bya ba'i phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba mngon par 'du bya ba rnams kyis chog mi shes par bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rtogs par bya ba'i phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba mngon par 'du bya ba rnams kyis chog mi shes par bya'o //
translated: In order to realize the wisdom of omniscience, they should not be satisfied with the creation of roots of virtue.

original: moonggal gyi bu /
analyzed: moonggal gyi bu /
translated: “Therefore, Maudgalyāyana,

original: ngas ting nge 'dzin shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes par bya ba'i don du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub yongs su tshol ba na bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas
analyzed: ngas ting nge 'dzin shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes par bya ba'i don du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub yongs su tshol ba na bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas
translated: I sought supreme and complete awakening in order to know the path that leads to the cessation of the knowledge of absorption.🔽When I had attained supreme and complete awakening,

original: nas ting nge 'dzin shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa sems can rnams la ji ltar yang dag par rab tu bstan par bya /
analyzed: nas ting nge 'dzin shes pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes pa sems can rnams la ji ltar yang dag par rab tu bstan par bya /
translated: I taught sentient beings the knowledge of the path that leads to the cessation of the knowledge of absorption.

original: bdag chos ston pa'ang zad pa med par gyur cig /
analyzed: bdag chos ston pa'ang zad pa med par gyur cig /
translated: I also taught the Dharma without it ever being exhausted.

original: snyam nas dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam pa sna tshogs du ma dag mngon par 'dus byas so //
analyzed: snyam nas dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam pa sna tshogs du ma dag mngon par 'dus byas so //
translated: I accumulated various roots of virtue.

original: moonggal gyi bu /
analyzed: moonggal gyi bu /
translated: “Maudgalyāyana,

original: sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus 'khor ba dpag tu med pa nas de'i pha rol gyi'ang ches pha rol na @327b de bzhin gshegs pa sgra thams cad kyi dbyangs zhes bya ba nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi bar 'jig rten du byung ngo //
analyzed: sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus 'khor ba dpag tu med pa nas de'i pha rol gyi'ang ches pha rol na @327b de bzhin gshegs pa sgra thams cad kyi dbyangs zhes bya ba nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi bar 'jig rten du byung ngo //
translated: In the past, innumerable eons ago, even before that, there was a thus-gone one called All-Sound Melody, up to and including Buddha, the Blessed One.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa sgra thams cad kyi dbyangs de'i nyan thos 'dus pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' 'dus pa dpag tu med pa dag byung ste chos bshad pa re res kyang nyan thos khrag khrig dpag tu med pa dag nges par byung ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa sgra thams cad kyi dbyangs de'i nyan thos 'dus pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' 'dus pa dpag tu med pa dag byung ste chos bshad pa re res kyang nyan thos khrag khrig dpag tu med pa dag nges par byung ngo //
translated: The thus-gone one All-Sound Melody had innumerable assemblies of hearers and bodhisattvas. Each time he taught the Dharma, he brought about the definite emergence of innumerable billions of hearers.

original: byang chub sems dpa' khrag khrig dpag tu med pa dag phyir mi ldog pa nyid la gnas so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' khrag khrig dpag tu med pa dag phyir mi ldog pa nyid la gnas so //
translated: He established innumerable billions of bodhisattvas in irreversibility.

original: de'i tshe de bzhin gshegs pa de'i byang chub sems dpa' bdud rtsi'i dbyangs zhes bya ba byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs de dag thams cad las yon tan dang / ye shes khyad par du 'phags pa zhig byung ngo //
analyzed: de'i tshe de bzhin gshegs pa de'i byang chub sems dpa' bdud rtsi'i dbyangs zhes bya ba byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs de dag thams cad las yon tan dang / ye shes khyad par du 'phags pa zhig byung ngo //
translated: At that time, the Thus-Gone One had a bodhisattva called Amṛtaghosa, who was superior in qualities and wisdom to all those bodhisattvas.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa'i bdud rtsi'i dbyangs de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa'i bdud rtsi'i dbyangs de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Then the bodhisattva Amṛtaghosa thought this:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa sgra thams cad kyi dbyangs 'dis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub yang dag par bsdus pa de bzhin du bdag gis kyang yang dag par rab tu bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa sgra thams cad kyi dbyangs 'dis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub yang dag par bsdus pa de bzhin du bdag gis kyang yang dag par rab tu bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: “Just as this Thus-Gone Sarva­śabda­ghoṣa has gathered the unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, so too I will gather it perfectly.”

original: snyam mo // de nas de bzhin gshegs pa sgra thams cad kyi dbyangs de'ang byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs chen po de'i mdun na bzhugs pa la tshigs su bcad pa'i dbyangs kyis zhu ba zhus ba /
analyzed: snyam mo // de nas de bzhin gshegs pa sgra thams cad kyi dbyangs de'ang byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs chen po de'i mdun na bzhugs pa la tshigs su bcad pa'i dbyangs kyis zhu ba zhus ba /
translated: Then the Thus-Gone Sarva­śabda­ghoṣa, in the presence of that great assembly of bodhisattvas, spoke these verses in response:

original: 'dren pa mi yi khyu mchog stobs bcu yon tan mnga' ba lha yul sa steng med //
analyzed: 'dren pa mi yi khyu mchog stobs bcu yon tan mnga' ba lha yul sa steng med //
translated: “You are the leader, the best of men, endowed with the ten powers and good qualities, in the heavens and on earth.

original: rgyal mchog mchog rab @328a *//
analyzed: rgyal mchog mchog rab @328a *//
translated: You are the best of kings, the most excellent,

original: lha mi phan mdzad pa la 'gro ba'i don du bdag zhu ba //
analyzed: lha mi phan mdzad pa la 'gro ba'i don du bdag zhu ba //
translated: the one who benefits gods and men. I ask you for the sake of the world:

original: spyod pa ji ltar spyad na blo gros legs mdzad 'gro ston khyod dang 'dra bar 'gyur //
analyzed: spyod pa ji ltar spyad na blo gros legs mdzad 'gro ston khyod dang 'dra bar 'gyur //
translated: How should one practice to become like you, O Teacher, the one with good understanding?

original: 'gro la phan mdzad bdag dang 'gro ba'i the tshom de dag myur du gsungs shig gsungs //
analyzed: 'gro la phan mdzad bdag dang 'gro ba'i the tshom de dag myur du gsungs shig gsungs //
translated: Please quickly explain to me and the world, O Benefactor of the World, these doubts of ours.”

original: 'gro ba rdul dang dri ma rnyog pa sdug bsngal brgya yis yongs ldan rig nas su //
analyzed: 'gro ba rdul dang dri ma rnyog pa sdug bsngal brgya yis yongs ldan rig nas su //
translated: “Knowing that the world is full of dust, stains, and the hundred sufferings,

original: mkhas pa snying rje bskyed de ji ltar spyod na 'gro phan skye rgu rnam 'grel bgyid //🔽ji ltar 'gro ba sdug bsngal brgyas nyen bde brgya'i phyi rol yid bde mi 'tshal rnams //
analyzed: mkhas pa snying rje bskyed de ji ltar spyod na 'gro phan skye rgu rnam 'grel bgyid // ji ltar 'gro ba sdug bsngal brgyas nyen bde brgya'i phyi rol yid bde mi 'tshal rnams //
translated: how should the wise one generate compassion and practice to liberate beings and benefit the world?🔽How should one teach the ten powers to the world, which is afflicted by the hundred sufferings, does not desire the hundred joys outside of the mind,

original: de dag bdag srid myur zad bde mchog mtshungs med 'gro la bstan gyi stobs bcu gsungs //
analyzed: de dag bdag srid myur zad bde mchog mtshungs med 'gro la bstan gyi stobs bcu gsungs //
translated: and quickly exhausts its own existence, so that it may attain the incomparable supreme bliss?”

original: ji ltar khyod kyi gsung chen thos nas rab tu dga' zhing 'gro ba yongs su bstan //
analyzed: ji ltar khyod kyi gsung chen thos nas rab tu dga' zhing 'gro ba yongs su bstan //
translated: Having heard your great speech, they are delighted and teach beings.

original: ji ltar 'gro ba khyod kyi gsung rtogs gsung la mkhas na sdug bsngal yongs su spong //
analyzed: ji ltar 'gro ba khyod kyi gsung rtogs gsung la mkhas na sdug bsngal yongs su spong //
translated: “How do beings understand your speech? When they are skilled in speech, they abandon suffering.

original: sdug bsngal zad thob mun bcom rab rib med cing rgyal ba'i nyi zer rab tu ldan //
analyzed: sdug bsngal zad thob mun bcom rab rib med cing rgyal ba'i nyi zer rab tu ldan //
translated: They attain the end of suffering, destroy darkness, are free from blindness, and possess the sun’s rays of the jinas.

original: stobs bcu mnga' ba'i gsung gis 'gro ba 'jigs med 'gyur bde dag bdag la gsungs //
analyzed: stobs bcu mnga' ba'i gsung gis 'gro ba 'jigs med 'gyur bde dag bdag la gsungs //
translated: “You who possess the ten powers, teach me the speech that brings beings happiness and fearlessness.🔽Having attained the speech of the jinas, who would not be happy and joyful, having abandoned deceitful words and abiding in speech?

original: rgyal ba'i gsung thob gsung gis g-yo tshig bcom ste su zhig gsung gnas dga' bder 'gyur; ;bde gshegs khyod kyi gsung 'chang mkhas pa dri ma skyon spangs shin tu dri med yid //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i gsung thob gsung gis g-yo tshig bcom ste su zhig gsung gnas dga' bder 'gyur; ;bde gshegs khyod kyi gsung 'chang mkhas pa dri ma skyon spangs shin tu dri med yid //
translated: “You who are skilled in possessing the speech of the sugatas, your mind is stainless and free of faults and stains.

original: des thob srid pa'i 'gro spangs 'gro ba mchog la gnas te rgyal mchog @328b 'gyur ba yi //
analyzed: des thob srid pa'i 'gro spangs 'gro ba mchog la gnas te rgyal mchog @328b 'gyur ba yi //
translated: Having attained that, they abandon the realms of existence and abide in the supreme state of being, becoming supreme jinas.

original: rgyal ba thub pa rnam 'dren 'gro la phan mdzad snyan pa'i gsung gis de dag gsungs //
analyzed: rgyal ba thub pa rnam 'dren 'gro la phan mdzad snyan pa'i gsung gis de dag gsungs //
translated: “Jinas, sages, guides, benefactors to beings, teach with your melodious speech.

original: ston pa de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten phan bzhed de yi bsam pa thugs chud lung bstan pa //
analyzed: ston pa de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten phan bzhed de yi bsam pa thugs chud lung bstan pa //
translated: The Teacher, the Tathāgata, who wishes to benefit the world, knows their thoughts and prophesies to them.

original: sdug bsngal 'di dag zad par rgyal bas gzigs pa'i mya ngan 'das pa'i lam bsgoms na //
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'di dag zad par rgyal bas gzigs pa'i mya ngan 'das pa'i lam bsgoms na //
translated: “ ‘If you cultivate the path to nirvāṇa, which the Jina has seen to be the end of suffering,

original: gang dag 'das pa'i 'jig rten phan 'dod gang yang ma 'ongs 'jig rten phan par 'dod //
analyzed: gang dag 'das pa'i 'jig rten phan 'dod gang yang ma 'ongs 'jig rten phan par 'dod //
translated: Those who in the past wished to benefit the world, and those who in the future will wish to benefit the world,

original: gang dag de ltar 'gro la phan 'dod de yang lam mchog 'di ni yongs su mthong //
analyzed: gang dag de ltar 'gro la phan 'dod de yang lam mchog 'di ni yongs su mthong //
translated: And those who in the present wish to benefit the world, will see this supreme path.

original: rgyal ba'i sras dag byang chub yongs su tshol na de ni rab tu 'bad de sgoms //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i sras dag byang chub yongs su tshol na de ni rab tu 'bad de sgoms //
translated: “ ‘The sons of the jinas, when seeking enlightenment, cultivate it with great effort.

original: bdud kyi stobs mchog bcas pa stobs bcom sangs rgyas stobs la mngon par myur du 'dug /
analyzed: bdud kyi stobs mchog bcas pa stobs bcom sangs rgyas stobs la mngon par myur du 'dug /
translated: They will quickly attain the power of the buddhas, the power that defeats the supreme power of Māra.

original: bu des thos nas thogs pa med par bde bar gshegs pa'i bzod la rab tu gnas //
analyzed: bu des thos nas thogs pa med par bde bar gshegs pa'i bzod la rab tu gnas //
translated: The sons, having heard that, will be established in the acceptance of the Sugata.

original: sangs rgyas sgra kun mkhyen pa rkang gnyis mchog la de ni skyabs song blo gnas so //🔽moonggal gyi bu /
analyzed: sangs rgyas sgra kun mkhyen pa rkang gnyis mchog la de ni skyabs song blo gnas so // moonggal gyi bu /
translated: They will go for refuge to the Buddha, the omniscient one, the supreme human, and their minds will be stable.

original: de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: de ji snyam du sems /
translated: “ ‘Maudgalyāyana, what do you think of that?

original: de'i tshe de'i dus na byang chub sems dpa' bdud rtsi'i dbyangs zhes bya bar gyur ba de gzhan yin par sems na /
analyzed: de'i tshe de'i dus na byang chub sems dpa' bdud rtsi'i dbyangs zhes bya bar gyur ba de gzhan yin par sems na /
translated: If you think that the one called Amṛtaghosa, the bodhisattva, at that time, on that occasion, was someone else,

original: de ltar mi blta ste /
analyzed: de ltar mi blta ste /
translated: you should not regard him in that way.

original: nga de'i tshe de'i dus na byang chub sems dpa' bdud rtsi'i dbyangs zhes bya bar gyur to //
analyzed: nga de'i tshe de'i dus na byang chub sems dpa' bdud rtsi'i dbyangs zhes bya bar gyur to //
translated: At that time, on that occasion, I was the bodhisattva called Amṛtaghosa.

original: de'i tshe'ang ngas sems can gyi khams sdug bsngal las yongs su thar bar byas so //🔽de ltar yang nga sems can rnams kyi sdug bsngal zad @329a *//
analyzed: de'i tshe'ang ngas sems can gyi khams sdug bsngal las yongs su thar bar byas so // de ltar yang nga sems can rnams kyi sdug bsngal zad @329a *//
translated: At that time, too, I liberated the realm of sentient beings from suffering.

original: par bya ba'i phyir chos ston to //

original: thos nas kyang de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: thos nas kyang de 'di snyam du sems te /

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa de ni; nges par thun mong ma yin pa'i ye shes dang ldan pas mkhas pa'o //
translated: ‘That Tathāgata is wise, possessing uncommon wisdom.

analyzed: gang gi 'khor de snyed cig yod pa de la chos dang mthun pas phyir brgal bar 'di la su'ang nus pa med do //

analyzed: gang bdag de bzhin gshegs pa dri med spyan de'i drung du song ste rnam par byang ba shes pa yang dag par 'du shes pa yongs su zhu bar bya'o //

original: snyam nas de srog chags 'bum phrag brgyad dang lhan cig /
analyzed: snyam nas de srog chags 'bum phrag brgyad dang lhan cig /

analyzed: bud med 'bum phrag brgyad dang lhan cig tu de bzhin gshegs pa dri med spyan ga la ba der dong ngo //

analyzed: de'i tshe de bzhin gshegs pa de srog chags khri phrag dpag tu med pa dag gis yongs su bskor ba la chos ston te /

original: 'khor de sgra chung la sems can thams cad kyi bsam zhing rna ba blags te chos nyan to //
analyzed: 'khor de sgra chung la sems can thams cad kyi bsam zhing rna ba blags te chos nyan to //
translated: In that assembly, there was little noise, and all beings listened attentively to the Dharma.

analyzed: de'i tshe 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor de'i nang na sgra tha na lud pa'i sgra tsam yang med de //
translated: At that time, in that assembly, there was not even the sound of a cough.

original: rgyal po de sngon gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags pas de bud med 'bum phrag brgyad kyi nang na 'dug bzhin du bsam gtan bzhi pa'i bar la snyoms par zhugs so //
analyzed: rgyal po de sngon gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags pas de bud med 'bum phrag brgyad kyi nang na 'dug bzhin du bsam gtan bzhi pa'i bar la snyoms par zhugs so //
translated: Because the king had previously accumulated roots of virtue, he was able to enter into the meditative absorption of the fourth concentration while sitting in the middle of his harem of eighty thousand women.

original: des de bzhin gshegs pa de mthong @353a *//
analyzed: des de bzhin gshegs pa de mthong @353a *//
translated: As soon as he saw the Thus-Gone One,

original: ba tsam nyid kyis dbang po de dag zhi /
analyzed: ba tsam nyid kyis dbang po de dag zhi /
translated: his faculties were soothed.

original: spyod lam zhi bar shes nas de bzhin gshegs pa de la gzhal du med pa'i dga' ba bskyed cing /
analyzed: spyod lam zhi bar shes nas de bzhin gshegs pa de la gzhal du med pa'i dga' ba bskyed cing /
translated: Knowing that his demeanor was peaceful, he generated immeasurable joy toward the Thus-Gone One.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa de'i 'khor 'di snyed cig yod pa la phyir brgal bar sus kyang mi nus so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa de'i 'khor 'di snyed cig yod pa la phyir brgal bar sus kyang mi nus so //
translated: “No one can challenge the existence of this many members of the Thus-Gone One’s retinue.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'khor 'di snyed cig yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khor 'di snyed cig yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there are this many members of the retinue.

original: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa de'i spyod lam zhi ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa de'i spyod lam zhi ste /
translated: In this way, the Thus-Gone One’s demeanor is peaceful.

original: spyod lam de dang 'dra ba gang yang med do //
analyzed: spyod lam de dang 'dra ba gang yang med do //
translated: There is no one with a demeanor like his.

original: thun mong ma yin no //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin no //
translated: It is not shared.

original: rnam grangs des ni /
analyzed: rnam grangs des ni /
translated: For this reason,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa de ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa de ni /
translated: the Thus-Gone One

original: the tshom med par thun mong ma yin pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa'o snyam mo //
analyzed: the tshom med par thun mong ma yin pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa'o snyam mo //
translated: He is endowed with extraordinary wisdom.

original: de 'khor de dag dang btsun mo'i 'khor de dag dang lhan cig tu de bzhin gshegs pa dri med spyan de ga la ba der dong ngo //
analyzed: de 'khor de dag dang btsun mo'i 'khor de dag dang lhan cig tu de bzhin gshegs pa dri med spyan de ga la ba der dong ngo //
translated: Then the king, together with his retinue and the queens, went to the Tathāgata Vimalanetra.

original: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa dri med spyan rgyang ring po nyid nas 'di skad bka' stsal te /🔽rgyal po chen po /
analyzed: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa dri med spyan rgyang ring po nyid nas 'di skad bka' stsal te / rgyal po chen po /
translated: From afar, the Tathāgata Vimalanetra said to him:🔽“Come, great king!

original: tshur spyon / rgyal po chen po /
analyzed: tshur spyon / rgyal po chen po /
translated: Welcome, great king!

original: legs par byon to //
analyzed: legs par byon to //
translated: You have come well, great king!

original: rgyal po chen po /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po /
translated: Great king,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mthong bar bya ba'i phyir yun ring po nas 'bad par byas so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mthong bar bya ba'i phyir yun ring po nas 'bad par byas so //
translated: you have striven for a long time to see the Tathāgata.

original: rgyal po chen po /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po /
translated: Great king,

original: khyod de bzhin gshegs pa mthong nas don yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyod de bzhin gshegs pa mthong nas don yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: your seeing the Tathāgata will not be in vain.

original: rgyal po chen po /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po /
translated: Great king,

original: khyod 'bras bu dang bcas par 'gro zhing /
analyzed: khyod 'bras bu dang bcas par 'gro zhing /
translated: you will go forth and have your reward.🔽Great king,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la zhus pa lung bstan pas brnag pa yongs @353b su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la zhus pa lung bstan pas brnag pa yongs @353b su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: your aspiration will be fulfilled by the Tathāgata’s answering your questions.”

original: de nas rgyal po dri med dbang bskur des 'khor dang lhan cig tu de bzhin gshegs pa de'i zhabs la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te phyogs gcig tu 'dug go /
analyzed: de nas rgyal po dri med dbang bskur des 'khor dang lhan cig tu de bzhin gshegs pa de'i zhabs la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te phyogs gcig tu 'dug go /
translated: Then King Vimalatejā, together with his retinue, bowed his head to the feet of that Tathāgata and sat to one side.

original: de'i tshe tshangs ris kyi lha bye ba phrag brgyad cu de bzhin gshegs pa de'i steng gi bar snang la thal mo sbyar te 'khod do //
analyzed: de'i tshe tshangs ris kyi lha bye ba phrag brgyad cu de bzhin gshegs pa de'i steng gi bar snang la thal mo sbyar te 'khod do //
translated: At that time, eight hundred million gods of the Brahmākāyika realm stood in the sky above that Tathāgata with palms joined.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha gang dag gi mig gis mthong bar mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha gang dag gi mig gis mthong bar mi 'gyur na /
translated: Those gods who were in the desire realm could not see with their eyes

original: mir gyur pas lta smos kyang ci dgos //
analyzed: mir gyur pas lta smos kyang ci dgos //
translated: what need is there to mention humans?

original: des na de bzhin gshegs pa dri med spyan des ji lta bu'i rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du mdzad pa mngon par 'du mdzad de /
analyzed: des na de bzhin gshegs pa dri med spyan des ji lta bu'i rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du mdzad pa mngon par 'du mdzad de /
translated: Therefore, that Tathāgata Vimalanetra performed a miracle such that

analyzed: de lta bu'i rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du mdzad pa mngon par 'du mdzad pas rgyal po dri med dbang bskur gyis mi'i 'khor de dang / 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha'i 'khor de dang / tshangs ris kyi lha'i 'khor de dag mthong ngo //
translated: The Tathāgata Vimalanetra, through such a miraculous manifestation, was seen by King Vimalatejā, his retinue of humans, his retinue of gods in the desire realm, and his retinue of gods in the Brahmā realm.

original: mthong nas 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: mthong nas 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Having seen this, he thought,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dri med spyan de la phyir rgol bar sus kyang mi nus te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dri med spyan de la phyir rgol bar sus kyang mi nus te /
translated: ‘No one can oppose that Tathāgata Vimalanetra.

original: 'di ni / gnas ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni / gnas ma yin no //
translated: This is impossible.

original: gang 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha 'di dag thams cad thal mo sbyar ba dang / tshangs ris kyi lha 'di dag bar snang la thal mo sbyar te 'dug pas phyir brgal bar gang lha dag gis kyang mi nus na /
analyzed: gang 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha 'di dag thams cad thal mo sbyar ba dang / tshangs ris kyi lha 'di dag bar snang la thal mo sbyar te 'dug pas phyir brgal bar gang lha dag gis kyang mi nus na /
translated: Since all these gods in the desire realm have their palms joined, and these gods in the Brahmā realm are in the sky with their palms joined, if even the gods cannot oppose him,

original: mir gyur pas lta smos kyang ci dgos snyam nas de stan las langs te pus mo g-yas pa'i lha @354a *//
analyzed: mir gyur pas lta smos kyang ci dgos snyam nas de stan las langs te pus mo g-yas pa'i lha @354a *//
translated: what need is there to speak of those who are human?’ Having thought this, he rose from his seat, placed his right knee on the ground,

original: nga sa la btsugs nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dri med spyan de ga la ba de logs su thal me sbyar ba btud do /
analyzed: nga sa la btsugs nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dri med spyan de ga la ba de logs su thal me sbyar ba btud do /
translated: I fell to the ground and bowed to the bhagavat tathagata Vimalanetra.

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dri med spyan de la tshigs su bcad de mngon par bstod pa //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dri med spyan de la tshigs su bcad de mngon par bstod pa //
translated: I praised the bhagavat tathagata Vimalanetra with these verses:

original: bam po bcu dgu pa /
analyzed: bam po bcu dgu pa /
translated: CHAPTER 19

original: mkhyen rab chen po chos kun pha rol gshegs la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: mkhyen rab chen po chos kun pha rol gshegs la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the one with great wisdom, who has gone to the other side of all phenomena.

original: lhar bcas 'jig rten gang dag khyod la thal mo sbyar nas mchis //
analyzed: lhar bcas 'jig rten gang dag khyod la thal mo sbyar nas mchis //
translated: The world with its gods is present, with palms joined in homage to you.

original: lha dang mi dang dri za mi 'am ci dang lto 'phye ce //
analyzed: lha dang mi dang dri za mi 'am ci dang lto 'phye ce //
translated: Gods, humans, gandharvas, kinnaras, and mahoragas

original: sangs rgyas la ni thams cad thal mo sbyar nas lta zhing mchis //
analyzed: sangs rgyas la ni thams cad thal mo sbyar nas lta zhing mchis //
translated: All look upon the Buddha with palms joined in homage.

original: 'di kun bcom ldan 'das kyi mkhyen rab kun tu gzigs nas mchis //
analyzed: 'di kun bcom ldan 'das kyi mkhyen rab kun tu gzigs nas mchis //
translated: All of them are present, looking upon the bhagavat’s wisdom.

original: des na lhar bcas 'jig rten thal mo sbyar nas phyag 'tshal bgyid //
analyzed: des na lhar bcas 'jig rten thal mo sbyar nas phyag 'tshal bgyid //
translated: Therefore the world with its gods bows with palms joined in homage.

original: mkhyen rab chen po khyod kyi mkhyen rab thob phyir phyag 'tshal te //
analyzed: mkhyen rab chen po khyod kyi mkhyen rab thob phyir phyag 'tshal te //
translated: We bow to you, O great wisdom, in order to attain your wisdom.

original: 'di kun bcom ldan 'das kyi mkhyen rab kun tu bzung nas mchis //
analyzed: 'di kun bcom ldan 'das kyi mkhyen rab kun tu bzung nas mchis //
translated: All this is due to the wisdom of the Lord.

original: khyod kyi gzugs dang 'dra ba ma mchis mkhyen rab 'dra ma mchis //
analyzed: khyod kyi gzugs dang 'dra ba ma mchis mkhyen rab 'dra ma mchis //
translated: There is no one equal to you in form, no one equal to you in wisdom.

original: 'di kun rkang gnyis mchog la yid kyis shes par bgyis nas mchis //
analyzed: 'di kun rkang gnyis mchog la yid kyis shes par bgyis nas mchis //
translated: All this is due to the mind of the Supreme One among Men.

original: ji ltar thos bzhin de ltar mthong ste de bas lhag par bzang //
analyzed: ji ltar thos bzhin de ltar mthong ste de bas lhag par bzang //
translated: As I have heard, so I have seen, and even more than that.

original: bdag gis bde gshegs mthong bas bdag ni mi nyid legs par rnyed //
analyzed: bdag gis bde gshegs mthong bas bdag ni mi nyid legs par rnyed //
translated: I have seen the Sugata, and so I have obtained the state of being human.

original: lha klu gnod sbyin lha ma yin dang de bzhin srin po dag /
analyzed: lha klu gnod sbyin lha ma yin dang de bzhin srin po dag /
translated: Gods, nagas, yakshas, asuras, and likewise rakshasas,

original: 'jig @354b brtan gsum na khyod dang 'dra ba ma mchis so //
analyzed: 'jig @354b brtan gsum na khyod dang 'dra ba ma mchis so //
translated: In the three worlds, there is no one equal to you.

original: 'dren pa gang la bdag gis sngon gyi brgal ba'i sems byung ba //
analyzed: 'dren pa gang la bdag gis sngon gyi brgal ba'i sems byung ba //
translated: O Guide, I have previously had doubts about you,

original: 'jig rten 'dren ba mthong tsam de nyid ma mchis so //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dren ba mthong tsam de nyid ma mchis so //
translated: But as soon as I saw the Leader of the World, those doubts disappeared.

original: brtson chen mkhyen rab thugs brtser ldan pa khyod la zhu bgyi ba //
analyzed: brtson chen mkhyen rab thugs brtser ldan pa khyod la zhu bgyi ba //
translated: O you of great diligence, wisdom, and compassion, I ask you:

analyzed: dge ba'i las gang bgyis pas skyon rnams kun gyis gos mi 'gyur //
translated: What virtuous karma can one perform so as to not be tainted by faults?

original: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa dri med spyan gyis rgyal po bdud rtsis dbang bskur de'i shes rab 'di lta bu 'byung po thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba de gsan nas gsung ma 'khrul pa dang / spobs pa grol bas rgyal po bdud rtsis dbang bskur de la slar tshigs su bcad de bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa dri med spyan gyis rgyal po bdud rtsis dbang bskur de'i shes rab 'di lta bu 'byung po thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba de gsan nas gsung ma 'khrul pa dang / spobs pa grol bas rgyal po bdud rtsis dbang bskur de la slar tshigs su bcad de bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Tathagata Vimalanetra, having heard that King Amritodaka had been anointed and that his wisdom was for the benefit and happiness of all beings, spoke these verses in reply to King Amritodaka with his unerring speech and liberated eloquence:

original: 'jig rten kun la phan byed zhu ba zhus pa legs so legs //
analyzed: 'jig rten kun la phan byed zhu ba zhus pa legs so legs //
translated: Excellent, excellent! Your request to benefit the entire world.

original: khyod kyi don de bshad kyi ji lta ba bzhin nga la nyon //
analyzed: khyod kyi don de bshad kyi ji lta ba bzhin nga la nyon //
translated: I will explain your meaning, so listen to me as I speak.

original: 'bar ba lta bur ye shes gang gis nyon mongs sreg par byed //
analyzed: 'bar ba lta bur ye shes gang gis nyon mongs sreg par byed //
translated: The wisdom that burns like a fire to consume the afflictions,

original: de ni shes nas yang dag bsdus te de 'drar sgrub byed na //
analyzed: de ni shes nas yang dag bsdus te de 'drar sgrub byed na //
translated: Having understood that, gather it together and accomplish it in that way.

original: nyon mongs dag las rnam grol shes pa de la mi chags te //
analyzed: nyon mongs dag las rnam grol shes pa de la mi chags te //
translated: Liberated from the afflictions, the mind is not attached to that knowledge.

original: ji ltar pha rol phyin pa gzings la ltos med bor nas 'gro //
analyzed: ji ltar pha rol phyin pa gzings la ltos med bor nas 'gro //
translated: Just as one crosses over to the other shore, leaving behind the boat without concern,

original: de bzhin rgyal ba'i mkhyen pas sdug bsngal rgyu ni sreg byed la //
analyzed: de bzhin rgyal ba'i mkhyen pas sdug bsngal rgyu ni sreg byed la //
translated: In the same way, the Victorious One's wisdom burns the causes of suffering,

original: shes pa de la gnas par mi byed 'di ni dge ba'i lam //
analyzed: shes pa de la gnas par mi byed 'di ni dge ba'i lam //
translated: They do not dwell on that knowledge, and that is the path of virtue.

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'jigs med mkhas pa de ni 'dir slob na //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'jigs med mkhas pa de ni 'dir slob na //
translated: The bodhisattva, the fearless and wise one, trains here

original: rtag tu mnyam par bzhag cing rnam g-yeng @355a *//
analyzed: rtag tu mnyam par bzhag cing rnam g-yeng @355a *//
translated: and is always in equipoise, free from distraction

original: 'di dag med par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'di dag med par 'gyur //
translated: and without these.🔽Walking, standing, sitting, or lying down, with a mind directed toward awakening,

original: byang chub gzhol ba'i sems kyis 'chag pa dang ni gnas pa dang // mkhas pa shes rab bcas pa 'dug dang mal du nyal bar byed //
analyzed: byang chub gzhol ba'i sems kyis 'chag pa dang ni gnas pa dang // mkhas pa shes rab bcas pa 'dug dang mal du nyal bar byed //
translated: the wise one, together with wisdom, does not dwell on any phenomena.

original: chos kun ngo bo nyid kyis ngo bo med par rab tu shes //
analyzed: chos kun ngo bo nyid kyis ngo bo med par rab tu shes //
translated: Knowing that all phenomena are essentially devoid of essence,

original: mkhas pa chos rnams thams cad la ni gnas par mi byed do //
analyzed: mkhas pa chos rnams thams cad la ni gnas par mi byed do //
translated: the wise one does not dwell on any phenomena.

original: 'jig rten mgon po slob pa de yi gsung de thos nas su //
analyzed: 'jig rten mgon po slob pa de yi gsung de thos nas su //
translated: Having heard that speech of the teacher, the protector of the world,

original: yid la brnag pa dga' zhing ston pa la ni mngon par bstod //
analyzed: yid la brnag pa dga' zhing ston pa la ni mngon par bstod //
translated: the one who had taken it to heart was delighted and praised the teacher:

original: 'jig rten spyod bcom 'jig rten gsal mdzad khyod la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: 'jig rten spyod bcom 'jig rten gsal mdzad khyod la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: “Homage to you, illuminator of the world, conqueror of worldly conduct!

original: 'dren pa rang gi grol bas sems can dag gi sdug bsngal bkrol //
analyzed: 'dren pa rang gi grol bas sems can dag gi sdug bsngal bkrol //
translated: Leader, through your own liberation you liberate sentient beings from suffering.”

original: ded dpon bla na med pa brtson 'grus chen po myur mjed pa //
analyzed: ded dpon bla na med pa brtson 'grus chen po myur mjed pa //
translated: You are the incomparable captain, with great diligence, swift and powerful.

original: 'dren pa rang gi rgal bas sems can mang po de dag bsgral //
analyzed: 'dren pa rang gi rgal bas sems can mang po de dag bsgral //
translated: You, the guide, have crossed over and liberated many beings.

original: khyod kyis ma rig pa yi sbubs bcom khyod kyis snang bas bstan //
analyzed: khyod kyis ma rig pa yi sbubs bcom khyod kyis snang bas bstan //
translated: You have destroyed the cocoon of ignorance and revealed the light.

original: khyod kyis 'od dpag med pas sangs rgyas zhing ni rab tu snang //
analyzed: khyod kyis 'od dpag med pas sangs rgyas zhing ni rab tu snang //
translated: You have illuminated the buddha realm with immeasurable light.

original: khyod kyi 'od kyis kun mkhyen sangs rgyas zhing ni dpag tu med //
analyzed: khyod kyi 'od kyis kun mkhyen sangs rgyas zhing ni dpag tu med //
translated: Your light illuminates the buddha realm of the omniscient one,

original: grangs med bye ba dag tu snang bas rtag tu khyab par mdzad //
analyzed: grangs med bye ba dag tu snang bas rtag tu khyab par mdzad //
translated: pervading countless millions of realms with light.

original: sgra gcan zla ba btang ltar nam mkha'i dkyil na dri ma med //
analyzed: sgra gcan zla ba btang ltar nam mkha'i dkyil na dri ma med //
translated: Like Rāhu releasing the moon, you are immaculate in the midst of space.

original: zla ba rnam par snang ltar de bzhin sangs rgyas rnam par snang //
analyzed: zla ba rnam par snang ltar de bzhin sangs rgyas rnam par snang //
translated: Like the moon shining, the Buddha shines in the same way.🔽Having cut the noose of the asuras, you are immaculate in the midst of space.

original: lha ma yin gyi zhags bcad nam mkha'i dkyil na dri ma @355b med; ;nyi ma'i 'od zer brgya dag rnam shar bar snang gsal byed ltar //
